SENT.plain: A boy had the clinical features of congenital muscular dystrophy with a very mild mental deficit
A muscle biopsy at one year of age showed the typical findings of Fukuyama-type congenital muscular dystrophy, including selective loss of immunoreactions for alpha dystroglycan
Magnetic resonance imaging showed no findings suggestive of migration disorders
The diagnosis of Fukuyama-type congenital muscular dystrophy was confirmed by a molecular assay at 8 years of age, and his haplotype analysis was heterozygous
At 9 years of age, his FIQ on the Wechsler Scale for Children revealed 69, while his IQ on the Tanaka Binnet scale of intelligence was 97
In this report the relationship between mild clinical condition of the studied case and its genotype is discussed
